member.summary: Gets or sets the progression order (jp2:progression-order).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.Jp2WriteDefines.Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets the quality layer PSNR, given in dB. The order is from left to right in ascending order (jp2:quality).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.Jp2WriteDefines.Rate
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression ratio values. Each value is a factor of compression, thus 20 means 20 times compressed. The order is from left to right in descending order. A final lossless quality layer is signified by the value 1 (jp2:rate).

member.name: T:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines
member.summary: Class for defines that are used when a dds image is written.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines.ClusterFit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether cluser fit is enabled or disabled (dds:cluster-fit).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines.Compression
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression that will be used (dds:compression).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines.Mipmaps
member.summary: Gets or sets the the number of mipmaps, zero will disable writing mipmaps (dds:mipmaps).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines.WeightByAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether weight by alpha is enabled or disabled when cluster fit is used (dds:weight-by-alpha).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.DdsWriteDefines.Defines
member.summary: Gets the defines that should be set as a define on an image.

member.summary: Interface for a define.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.IDefine.Format
member.summary: Gets the format to set the define for.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.IDefine.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the define.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.IDefine.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the define.

member.summary: Interface for an object that specifies defines for an image.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.IDefines.Defines
member.summary: Gets the defines that should be set as a define on an image.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.IWriteDefines
member.summary: Interface for defines that are used when writing an image.

member.summary: Class for defines that are used when a png image is read.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PngReadDefines.PreserveiCCP
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the PNG decoder and encoder examine any ICC profile that is present. By default, the PNG decoder and encoder examine any ICC profile that is present, either from an iCCP chunk in the PNG input or supplied via an option, and if the profile is recognized to be the sRGB profile, converts it to the sRGB chunk. You can use this option to prevent this from happening; in such cases the iCCP chunk will be read. (png:preserve-iCCP)

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PngReadDefines.SkipProfiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the profile(s) that should be skipped when the image is read (profile:skip).

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PngReadDefines.SwapBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the bytes should be swapped. The PNG specification requires that any multi-byte integers be stored in network byte order (MSB-LSB endian). This option allows you to fix any invalid PNG files that have 16-bit samples stored incorrectly in little-endian order (LSB-MSB). (png:swap-bytes)

member.name: T:ImageMagick.DrawablePushPattern
member.summary: indicates that subsequent commands up to a DrawablePopPattern command comprise the definition of a named pattern. The pattern space is assigned top left corner coordinates, a width and height, and becomes its own drawing space. Anything which can be drawn may be used in a pattern definition. Named patterns may be used as stroke or brush definitions.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.DrawableStrokeDashArray
member.summary: Specifies the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths. The stroke dash array represents an array of numbers that specify the lengths of alternating dashes and gaps in pixels. If an odd number of values is provided, then the list of values is repeated to yield an even number of values. To remove an existing dash array, pass a null dasharray. A typical stroke dash array might contain the members 5 3 2.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.DrawableStrokeMiterLimit
member.summary: Specifies the miter limit. When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'DrawableStrokeLineJoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path. The 'DrawableStrokeMiterLimit' imposes a limit on the ratio of the miter length to the 'DrawableStrokeLineWidth'.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathArc
member.summary: Draws an elliptical arc from the current point to(X, Y). The size and orientation of the ellipse are defined by two radii(RadiusX, RadiusY) and a RotationX, which indicates how the ellipse as a whole is rotated relative to the current coordinate system. The center of the ellipse is calculated automagically to satisfy the constraints imposed by the other parameters. UseLargeArc and UseSweep contribute to the automatic calculations and help determine how the arc is drawn. If UseLargeArc is true then draw the larger of the available arcs. If UseSweep is true, then draw the arc matching a clock-wise rotation.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.PathArc.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.PathArc.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Indicates how the ellipse as a whole is rotated relative to the current coordinate system.
If true then draw the larger of the available arcs.
If true then draw the arc matching a clock-wise rotation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the X radius.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PathArc.RadiusY
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y radius.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PathArc.RotationX
member.summary: Gets or sets how the ellipse as a whole is rotated relative to the current coordinate system.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PathArc.UseLargeArc
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whetherthe larger of the available arcs should be drawn.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.PathArc.UseSweep
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the arc should be drawn matching a clock-wise rotation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Y offset from origin.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathArcAbs
member.summary: Draws an elliptical arc from the current point to (X, Y) using absolute coordinates. The size and orientation of the ellipse are defined by two radii(RadiusX, RadiusY) and an RotationX, which indicates how the ellipse as a whole is rotated relative to the current coordinate system. The center of the ellipse is calculated automagically to satisfy the constraints imposed by the other parameters. UseLargeArc and UseSweep contribute to the automatic calculations and help determine how the arc is drawn. If UseLargeArc is true then draw the larger of the available arcs. If UseSweep is true, then draw the arc matching a clock-wise rotation.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathArcRel

The size and orientation of the ellipse are defined by two radii(RadiusX, RadiusY) and an RotationX, which indicates how the ellipse as a whole is rotated relative to the current coordinate system. The center of the ellipse is calculated automagically to satisfy the constraints imposed by the other parameters. UseLargeArc and UseSweep contribute to the automatic calculations and help determine how the arc is drawn. If UseLargeArc is true then draw the larger of the available arcs. If UseSweep is true, then draw the arc matching a clock-wise rotation.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathSmoothCurveToAbs
member.summary: Draws a cubic Bezier curve from the current point to (x,y) using absolute coordinates. The first control point is assumed to be the reflection of the second control point on the previous command relative to the current point. (If there is no previous command or if the previous command was not an PathCurveToAbs, PathCurveToRel, PathSmoothCurveToAbs or PathSmoothCurveToRel, assume the first control point is coincident with the current point.) (x2,y2) is the second control point (i.e., the control point at the end of the curve). At the end of the command, the new current point becomes the final (x,y) coordinate pair used in the polybezier.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.PathSmoothCurveToAbs.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.PathSmoothCurveToAbs.#ctor(ImageMagick.PointD,ImageMagick.PointD)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.PathSmoothCurveToAbs.ImageMagick#IDrawingWand#Draw(ImageMagick.DrawingWand)
member.summary: Draws this instance with the drawing wand.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathSmoothCurveToRel
member.summary: Draws a cubic Bezier curve from the current point to (x,y) using relative coordinates. The first control point is assumed to be the reflection of the second control point on the previous command relative to the current point. (If there is no previous command or if the previous command was not an PathCurveToAbs, PathCurveToRel, PathSmoothCurveToAbs or PathSmoothCurveToRel, assume the first control point is coincident with the current point.) (x2,y2) is the second control point (i.e., the control point at the end of the curve). At the end of the command, the new current point becomes the final (x,y) coordinate pair used in the polybezier.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathSmoothQuadraticCurveToAbs
member.summary: Draws a quadratic Bezier curve (using absolute coordinates) from the current point to (X, Y). The control point is assumed to be the reflection of the control point on the previous command relative to the current point. (If there is no previous command or if the previous command was not a PathQuadraticCurveToAbs, PathQuadraticCurveToRel, PathSmoothQuadraticCurveToAbs or PathSmoothQuadraticCurveToRel, assume the control point is coincident with the current point.). At the end of the command, the new current point becomes the final (X,Y) coordinate pair used in the polybezier.

member.name: T:ImageMagick.PathSmoothQuadraticCurveToRel
member.summary: Draws a quadratic Bezier curve (using relative coordinates) from the current point to (X, Y). The control point is assumed to be the reflection of the control point on the previous command relative to the current point. (If there is no previous command or if the previous command was not a PathQuadraticCurveToAbs, PathQuadraticCurveToRel, PathSmoothQuadraticCurveToAbs or PathSmoothQuadraticCurveToRel, assume the control point is coincident with the current point.). At the end of the command, the new current point becomes the final (X,Y) coordinate pair used in the polybezier.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.MagickImage.ContrastStretch(ImageMagick.Percentage)
member.summary: A simple image enhancement technique that attempts to improve the contrast in an image by 'stretching' the range of intensity values it contains to span a desired range of values. It differs from the more sophisticated histogram equalization in that it can only apply a linear scaling function to the image pixel values. As a result the 'enhancement' is less harsh.
member.exception: Thrown when an error is raised by ImageMagick.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.MagickImageCollection.Optimize
member.summary: Compares each image the GIF disposed forms of the previous image in the sequence. From this it attempts to select the smallest cropped image to replace each frame, while preserving the results of the GIF animation.
member.exception: Thrown when an error is raised by ImageMagick.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.MagickImageCollection.OptimizePlus
member.summary: OptimizePlus is exactly as Optimize, but may also add or even remove extra frames in the animation, if it improves the total number of pixels in the resulting GIF animation.
member.exception: Thrown when an error is raised by ImageMagick.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.MagickImageCollection.OptimizeTransparency
member.summary: Compares each image the GIF disposed forms of the previous image in the sequence. Any pixel that does not change the displayed result is replaced with transparency.
member.exception: Thrown when an error is raised by ImageMagick.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokeDashArray
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths. This represents a zero-terminated array of numbers that specify the lengths of alternating dashes and gaps in pixels. If a zero value is not found it will be added. If an odd number of values is provided, then the list of values is repeated to yield an even number of values.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokeDashOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash (default 0) while drawing using a dash pattern,.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokeLineCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokeLineJoin
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape to be used at the corners of paths (or other vector shapes) when they are stroked.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokeMiterLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the miter limit. When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'lineJoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path. The miterLimit' imposes a limit on the ratio of the miter length to the 'lineWidth'. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern image to use while stroking object outlines.

member.name: P:ImageMagick.MagickSettings.StrokeWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the stroke width for drawing lines, circles, ellipses, etc.

member.summary: Updates the data of the profile.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The byte array to read the exif profile from.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The fully qualified name of the exif profile file, or the relative exif profile file name.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The stream to read the exif profile from.

member.summary: Gets or sets which parts will be written when the profile is added to an image.

member.summary: Gets the tags that where found but contained an invalid value.

member.summary: Gets the values of this exif profile.

member.name: M:ImageMagick.ExifProfile.CreateThumbnail
member.summary: Returns the thumbnail in the exif profile when available.

member.summary: Returns the value with the specified tag.

member.returns: The value with the specified tag.

member.summary: Sets the value of the specified tag.
